summary:
Bruce: if we do this, how do we know that it won't end up like it did last time? 
Carol: because now you have me. 
So, the rest...
body:
Bruce: if we do this, how do we know that it won’t end up like it did last time?

Carol: because now you have me.

So, the rest of the meme tells itself. This is pure sexism, let’s be real here, and I know a lot of people will try to deny that it is. We had a decade of Tony Stark, a character we all LOVE, be an arrogant mofo and he never got this reaction. To the contrary, everyone praised his line “Genius billionaire playboy philanthropist”, and so many others. Doctor Strange is just the same… Actually, Doctor Strange is a literal asshole, and everyone loves him.

This reminded me of my own school days. There was this guy everyone praised and loved because he was so good at math and science classes. I would get the same or better grades he did in all of those courses. However, if I got a 98 and he also got a 98 in, say, physics, I was an annoying know-it-all and he was a smart young boy.

They’re leaders, we’re bossy; they’re smart, we’re annoying know-it-alls; they’re passionate, we’re crazy. I am so over this bullshit.

summary: Clint passing the gauntlet to Black Panther then to Spider-Man and then to Captain Marvel was a big passing of the torch moment....
body:
Clint passing the gauntlet to Black Panther then to Spider-Man and then to Captain Marvel was a big passing of the torch moment.

When you think about it, Clint has been the one who brought a new member to the team. I.E. Wanda Maximoff.

reblog.comment:

She/Her | 18
Hi, I'm Lime.
You're probably here because you're mad at me over something. Hit me with your best shot, anon asks are open.

summary: Fuck you captain marvel is grear
question: Fuck you captain marvel is grear
answer:
Oh yeah? Why? She is overpowered, and overpowered characters are really difficult to pull off properly. She isn’t relatable, which is ironic for a character who is supposed to be the ultimate “female representation”. I don’t feel represented by her, I feel infantilized and frankly sickened that both Brie and the directors/producers think that their character shouldn’t have any flaws in order to not be called sexist.

-

Strong and empowered doesn’t mean inhuman or without flaws. Strong and empowered doesn’t mean “THE STRONGEST IN THE WHOLE UNIVERSE WITH THE POWER OF THE STAAAAAAARS AND NO ACTUAL FLAWS”. Especially because it makes every. single. plot. involving her seem so boring and bland, like you have to manufacture bullshit excuses for there to be any tension in battles whatsoever because technically, the character is a god and nothing should be able to beat her. [SPOILERS] There is a point in Endgame where Brie fights Thanos, and she loses/is tossed aside. Which makes no sense considering what her moveset is supposed to be. Thanos SHOULD NOT BE a challenge to Carol, at all, yet he is, because plot. This shouldn’t happen, and it’s the problem with OP characters, they are way too powerful so every challenge feels fake and hollow [END OF SPOILERS]

-

Then there’s also the retconning thing. I hate retconning. It’s lazy. Out of nowhere this deus ex machina pops up like she’s supposedly been there all along, and she’s the “most powerful” avenger and all that bullshit. We didn’t need any more strong Avengers, we have so many.

Then there’s how she was advertised as the first female hero etc etc. Well sorry that we forgot about:

-Scarlet Witch/Wanda Maximoff (who is a very strong woman with the power of the mindstone, already borderline OP, but offset by the fact that she’s an interesting character and her battles aren’t insta-wins. She feels like a whole ass character with good parts and bad parts and I love her)

-Gamora (who is a goddamn amazing character, amazing fighter)

-Nebula (who is also great, a joy to watch, both Gamora and Nebula grow SO MUCH as characters)

-Pepper Potts (WHO GETS SHIT DONE and is highly important behind the scenes, the only voice of reason around here)

-Black Widow/Natasha Romanov (who kicks ass and takes names, and has an interesting backstory.)

-Mantis (who kicks names and takes ass)

-Okoye (who, as much as I hate Black Panther, is a cool fighter, good with spear, not unnecessarily OP)

-Valkyrie and Sif (who are also cool, Valkyrie is rad, and she has a pegasus, so double rad. Sif is also strong.)

-Hela (not a hero but cool and strong anyways)

and that’s just off the top of my head. X-Men definitely has a couple more. Shuri doesn’t count for me because she also suffers from “OP retcon syndrome” and is actually racist lmfao.

-

Onwards….
The advertising is fucking bullshit. Give one of these ladies a standalone instead of this brand new character who we haven’t see in the MCU yet. Black Widow standalone, anyone? I know we’re getting a Wanda/Vision spin off and I am so here for that. But we didn’t need to introduce a whole ass new character just before Endgame, and then give her screentime in endgame, which for all intents and purposes was supposed to be the bookend for our existing characters.

Plus, I think it’s sexist to focus solely on the gender of a character. A character isn’t automatically great cause they’re female. Females aren’t saints. I am not a baby and I don’t need to be spoon-fed “representation”, because I can empathize with characters regardless of if they have a dick or a vag. As soon as the dick or the vag becomes a focus, we have a problem. We don’t need to be dumbed down into gender boxes.

-

Aside from that and on a more petty note Brie Larson can’t act, not well, and she’s a stuck up person with an ego bigger than any star. Maybe some of y’all think she’s attractive or whatever, and I mean, fine, that’s your right, just as it’s your right to like her etc., I personally think she sucks. And I just can’t get behind her. She refuses to accept criticism (just like a lot of you), “It isn’t made for you” isn’t a valid shield, you can’t just call all your critics trolls or generalize them all to be men. I’m a girl. And I hate her and the movie. Checkmate Brie.

-

In short. Fuck you too. And fuck Brie Larson especially. And Kevin Feige for defending her bullshit. Even the cast hates her. oof.

title: Avengers Endgame. Solo diré: ¡Excélsior!
body:
Avengers Endgame. Solo diré: ¡Excélsior!

  • Norma Lorena Loeza
  • USA 2019.
  • Dir. Joe Russo, Anthony Russo.
  • Reparto: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo, Brie Larson, Josh Brolin, Jeremy Renner, Paul Rudd, Tom Holland, Don Cheadle, Gwyneth Paltrow, Benedict Cumberbatch, Samuel L. Jackson.

tags: stupid nerds who cant handle one character who doesnt represent them on screen
im so tired but i cant stop fighting
i just want to be heard
summary: Is anyone else sick and tired of having to argue about the reality of their lives with uneducated and opinionated white guys???...
body: Is anyone else sick and tired of having to argue about the reality of their lives with uneducated and opinionated white guys??? Like I’m sick of having to argue about how that woman isn’t rude and bitchy, just opinionated and doesn’t take shit from white guys or how simply being a feminist is considered bad or how Brie Larson is the most unlikeable human being because she voices her opinion. The only people I see hating her are grown white men on YouTube with their nerd mermorabilia behind them. Like it’s exhausting, I can’t keep arguing with people about how my life deserves to be respected and represented like yours. But I also feel worse when I stop caring, like hearing and reading these things is saddening and infuriating but I can’t let it go, it’s a battle I can’t stop fighting no matter how tired I am but I would give anything for it to be over

body:
Girl power

After that epic girl power moment in Avengers Endgame. I’ll will never be prouder to be told to fight like a girl. For one reason. They kicked names and took ass!!!

body:

trail.content_raw:
Carol Danvers:

Me:

summary:
I came across a “cringey moments compilation” video today and it has some really absurd comments: 
And i’ve had enough, so here...
body:
ABOUT BRIE LARSON’S HATERS

I came across a “cringey moments compilation” video today and it has some really absurd comments:

And i’ve had enough, so here is my rant:

You guys call this toxicity? why? where? This is just (if not adorable ) awkwardness we all have. Plus some extra confidence mirroring the manners of RDJ, who is loved and known for that.( No offense, i love him) Are YOU sure that it’s HER who is being toxic here? Nobody in their right mind would hate on people bc of an edited video, if not AT ALL? Where is the proof that shows the cast doesn’t like her? And don’t show me some interviews where you speculated it based on facial expressions of the actors with NO CONTEXT. They are not even TALKING ABOUT HER?!? How about this:

Plus, this:

And this:

NEXT, y’all saying Brie’s rubbing feminism in your face? First, that’s your impression. You won’t care if you have no problems with it! Btw, why would you be bothered by feminism? Is “FEmiNiSm” really that annoying? Isn’t it a good thing? Isn’t it JUSTICE? Isn’t fighting for justice for others and doing what’s right are what heroes and SUPERheroes about? Isn’t that’s what MARVEL about?!?! It’s too much for your fragile ego to handle? Cool! I’m thankful because there are still people like her who are brave enough to stand for what’s right despite all the hates you guys are sending toward her.

Some of you claimed to love the MCU, well i’m not saying it’s not true but i’m loving the fact that you guys are believing that Endgame, the film which had been crafted and written carefully for almost 10 years, and the whole MCU, will be ruined by one woman. Great faith right there!

And for the one who made that video, i don’t know if you feel like that about Brie or not. If yes, shame on you. If you did this for views, even worse. GREAT DAY, and thanks for coming to my ted-talk.

blog.name: pr-ay-the-gay-away
blog.title: PR(ay)ing The Gay Away
blog.description: One stupid-ass stunt at a time

summary: Someone Great is millennial self-indulgence, and whilst I recognize it is peak (I repeat: PEAK) bourgeoisie, it was fun and...
body:
Someone Great is millennial self-indulgence, and whilst I recognize it is peak (I repeat: PEAK) bourgeoisie, it was fun and positive whilst also managing to be terrifyingly confronting. And the soundtrack SLAPS.

(Unicorn Store and Someone Great just fucking calling me out on all of my millennial angst)
